name: Al-Arqam Islamic School
mission: TO MEET THE EDUCATIONAL NEEDS OF THE MUSLIM CHILDREN LIVING WITHIN THE GREATER SACRAMENTO AREA.
theoryOfChange: Al-Arqam Islamic School & College Preparatory has five Schoolwide Learning Outcomes (SLOs) conveyed through the acrostic TORCH. These SLOs are focused on establishing strong, cohesive, and engaging school programs designed to impact students academically, spiritually, socially, and physically. The revision process for these learner outcomes began in the Spring of the 2017-2018 academic year. The school's mission is to teach and nurture the 'whole' child—intellectually, spiritually, emotionally, and physically—and to instill principles of submission to the Will of Allah for personal and academic excellence. Their goals include teaching a love for Islam, practicing Islam daily, achieving first-rate academic standards, striving for excellence to compete effectively, and developing strong moral and spiritual character, self-worth, discipline, independence, ethical standards, love of learning, citizenship, and responsibility. The Islamic Education curriculum also aims for students to live Islam through submission to Allah, know Islam's history, use the Qur'an and Sunnah for decisions, take Prophet Muhammad (SAW) as a role model, and become lifelong learners by developing good study habits and being intellectual and well-rounded.

evaluationSources: Western Association of Schools and Colleges (WASC)

zakatClaimEvidence: The 'Donations' page of Al-Arqam Islamic School lists methods for general donations (checks, PayPal, Zelle) but does not explicitly mention 'zakat' or 'zakat-eligible' funds. (Source: https://www.charitynavigator.org/ein/943311132#financials)

components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or clearly state whether donations are zakat-eligible.

all_citations.claim: The organization reported a program expense ratio of 98.1% and 9.1 months of working capital.
Total revenue for the period was $4,155,519 with a fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised.
The school provides college preparatory academics and an International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Program.
The organization operates as Al-Arqam Islamic School & College Preparatory in the Greater Sacramento area.
The school maintains a structured educational environment through a student honor code and parent policy handbook.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The school earns a 66/100 due to its high direct impact on student capacity building and excellent financial efficiency, though its overall score is moderated by a specific donor fit and medium data confidence.
areas_for_improvement: Limited data regarding specific long-term student outcomes and post-graduation impact metrics
Lower alignment for general donors due to a highly localized and specific community focus

dimension_explanations.alignment: While the school serves a critical educational need within the Sacramento Muslim community, its alignment score reflects a specialized donor fit and a localized track record [1][4]. As a Sadaqah-eligible institution, it provides a pathway for general charitable giving toward global education causes [2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The school demonstrates high impact through capacity building, utilizing 98.1% of its $4,155,519 revenue for program expenses [1][2]. Its commitment to academic excellence is evidenced by the implementation of the International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Program and a strict honor code for student conduct [3][5].

baseline_narrative.headline: Al-Arqam Islamic School provides rigorous college preparatory and International Baccalaureate education to Muslim youth in the Greater Sacramento area.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 98.1%, indicating nearly all funds go directly to educational services
Offers the prestigious International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Program for advanced student development
Strong financial stability with 9.1 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: Al-Arqam Islamic School is a dedicated educational institution focused on meeting the academic and spiritual needs of Muslim children through a comprehensive college preparatory curriculum [3][5]. The organization operates with a high degree of financial efficiency, reporting total revenue of $4,155,519 while maintaining a strong focus on direct program delivery [1][2].

case_against.mitigation_notes: The school's 28-year track record and IB accreditation serve as proxies for educational quality.
case_against.summary: The primary limitation is the <cite id="14">lack of specific long-term outcome metrics</cite> and a highly localized scope.

confidence.notes: Strong financial data but limited impact reporting.

alignment.improvement: The school could <cite id="15">add a dedicated giving page</cite> to clearly state how donations support underserved populations.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust the institution due to its <cite id="12">100% independent board</cite> and long history of service since <cite id="1">1998</cite>. The school maintains <cite id="16">total assets of $2,633,655</cite> with very low liabilities.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the school could publish annual impact reports detailing <cite id="14">student graduation rates and college placement outcomes</cite>.

impact.explanation: The school achieves a high impact score due to its <cite id="6">100.0% program ratio</cite> and its role in <cite id="17">capacity building</cite> within the Muslim community through advanced education.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="14">consistently publishing beneficiary counts</cite> so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade B - Verified outcomes through accreditation

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct service provider; does not primarily make grants.

rich_narrative.headline: Al-Arqam Islamic School provides rigorous college preparatory and International Baccalaureate education to Muslim youth in the Greater Sacramento area.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value Islamic institutional development and want to invest in high-quality, long-term educational infrastructure for Muslim youth.
donor_motivations: Want to support the integration of Islamic values with rigorous academics
Value established institutions with a 25+ year track record
Prefer supporting organizations with extremely low overhead
Care about local community empowerment through education
giving_considerations: Impact is concentrated within a specific geographic region
The school relies heavily on tuition-based program revenue
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fulfill zakat obligations or those looking for international humanitarian relief operations.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The school's curriculum is <cite id="2">IB-accredited</cite>, which requires external validation of educational standards.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The school creates impact by providing a dual-curriculum environment that prepares students for higher education while grounding them in Islamic identity.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Accreditation ensures that the educational services provided meet global benchmarks for college readiness.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The school has a stable revenue base but could expand its scholarship programs for underserved students with more sadaqah support.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by a <cite id="6">98.1% program expense ratio</cite>, which is significantly higher than the <cite id="10">peer median of 89.6%</cite>.

strengths.detail: The school directs <cite id="6">100.0% of its expenses toward programs</cite>, significantly exceeding the <cite id="10">peer program ratio median of 89.6%</cite>.
Al-Arqam is a provider of the <cite id="2">International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Program</cite>, a gold standard in global college preparatory education.
The organization maintains <cite id="9">9.1 months of operating reserves</cite>, ensuring long-term sustainability for its students.

strengths_deep_dive: Al-Arqam's financial model is highly sustainable, characterized by a <cite id="11">3-year revenue CAGR of 3.1%</cite>. Unlike many nonprofits that rely heavily on volatile donations, the school generates the vast majority of its income through <cite id="8">program service revenue</cite>, which totaled nearly $4 million in 2023. This allows the institution to maintain <cite id="12">100% independent board oversight</cite> while focusing entirely on its mission of providing <cite id="13">college preparatory academics and Islamic education</cite> to the Sacramento area.
rich_narrative.summary: Al-Arqam Islamic School & College Preparatory is a comprehensive educational institution that has served the Greater Sacramento Muslim community since its <cite id="1">founding in 1998</cite>. The school provides a rigorous academic environment characterized by its <cite id="2">International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Program</cite> and a variety of <cite id="3">Advanced Placement (AP) and Honors courses</cite>. With a mission to meet the educational needs of Muslim children, the institution integrates <cite id="4">Tarbiyyah, including Islamic Studies and Qur’an</cite>, into its college preparatory curriculum. Financially, the organization demonstrates exceptional efficiency, reporting <cite id="5">total revenue of $4,155,519</cite> in 2023, with a <cite id="6">program expense ratio of 98.1%</cite>. This indicates that nearly all funds are directed toward educational services and student development. The school maintains a <cite id="7">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, reflecting a model primarily supported by program service revenue rather than aggressive public solicitation. This revenue structure is diversified, with <cite id="8">$3,925,159 generated from program services</cite> and $224,548 from contributions. The institution's stability is further evidenced by its <cite id="9">9.1 months of working capital</cite>, providing a resilient financial cushion for its operations.
